title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

Films with Ratings and Categories



-1- Off-beat Action Films with Substance, Style, and a Sense of Ironic Humor


**** Inglourious Basterds
**** Burn After Reading
**** Hot Fuzz
***** Kill Bill Volume I & II
*** Face Off
****** Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
***** Snatch
***** Django Unchained
***** Reservoir Dogs
******* Pulp Fiction
******* Heat
*** Oceans Twelve
*** Be Cool
***** The Town
**** Kick Ass
*** BlackkKlansmen
*** Baby Driver
***** Villainess




-2- Films Based on Historical Periods, Often Hard-Hitting


******* Waltz With Bashir
******* It’s Such a Beautiful Day
***** Argo
******* Persepolis
****** Gomorrah
****** Sicario
***** Battle of Chernobyl
**** The Prophet




-3- Experimental Short Films


******* Ryan (Short)
****** Crumb
*** I Sisyphus (Short)
**** I Met The Walrus (Short)
*** An Andalusian Dog




-4- Documentaries on Social Phenomena


**** Religilous
***** Kedi
****** Why We Fight
**** Hitler: The Rise of Evil
*** God Grew Tired of Us
****** Doctor’s Diaries
****** Prohibition
***** Manufacturing Consent: Noam Chomsky and the Media (1992)
******* Shake Hands With The Devil
******* The War You Don’t See
**** Sicko
***** Inside Job
****** Spotlight
***** Merchants of Doubt
***** Minecraft: The Story of Mojang
****** Food Inc
****** The Big Short
**** Food Matters
*** Super Size Me
**** Jesus Camp
*** A Better Life
***** Catfish
***** Das Boot




-5- Documentaries About Inspiring Performers, Mostly Musicians


**** Live! Tonight! Sold Out!!
*** Live At Reading
******* The Devil And Daniel Johnston
****** About a Son
****** Cobain: Montage of Heck
***** John Lennon Vs US
******* Man on Wire
**** A Hard Day’s Night
***** 8 Mile




-6- The Best of Psychological Thrillers


******* Se7en
***** Gone Girl
***** Mystic River
**** Pathology
***** Dallas Buyers Club
***** Puncture
***** A Scanner Darkly
**** The Zodiac Killer
****** Fermat’s Room
**** Cube
******* Silence of the Lambs
*** Red Dragon
*** The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo (English)
**** 21 Grams
****** The Double
**** Super 8
****** Memento
**** John Wick
**** American Psycho
****** Nightcrawler
***** Get Out
******* The Handmaiden




-7- Guilty-Pleasure Comedies


***** Borat
*** Bruno
***** Southpark Bigger Longer Uncut
**** Idiocracy
*** Jackass 1-2
*** Austin Powers
**** Strange Wilderness
*** MacGruber
***** Kung Fury
*** Kenny




-8- Guilty-Pleasure Comedies (Less So)


**** 40 Year Old Virgin
****** Superbad
**** Juno
**** The Hangover




-9- Esoteric, Socially Meaningful Comedies


******* Office Space
**** Sideways
***** The Big Lebowski
***** Napoleon Dynamite




-10- Fantasy Films with Wonder and Adventure


**** Pirates of the Caribbean 1-2
**** The Day After Tomorrow
**** The Revenant
***** Lord of the Rings Trilogy
******* Pan’s Labyrinth
******* The Fountain
***** Hugo
***** Harry Potter Series
**** Avatar
***** Shape of Water
*** Okja
**** Planet of the Apes




-11- Animated 3D Films, Feel-Good Stories


******* Wall-E
***** Toy Story 2
***** Chicken Run
***** Toy Story 3
****** A Bug’s Life
*** The Incredibles
****** Frozen
**** E.T.
****** Finding Nemo
***** Up
**** Inside Out




-12- Animated Cartoons, Mostly for Children


**** Hercules
****** Pinocchio
******* Lion King
***** Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe (1979)
****** Nausicaa of the Valley of the Wind




-13- Action Movies with Substance, Dark and Visceral


**** Bourne Trilogy
**** Die Hard
***** Speed
****** The Terminator 1 and 2
******* Snowpiercer
***** Mad Max
****** Mad Max 2
****** Mad Max: Fury Road
****** Blade Runner




-14- Action Films with Drama Elements


******* Bonnie and Clyde
******* Chinatown
****** The Grifters
***** Blue Velvet
***** All About My Mother
**** Drive
****** Leon




-15- Superhero Movies


***** Iron Man
**** Star Trek (2009)
***** Star Wars (Original Trilogy)
**** Unbreakable
******* The Dark Knight
*** Logan
*** Black Panther
*** Deadpool




-16- Inspiring Science Fiction Movies


****** The Matrix
**** Blade Runner 2049
***** Inception
**** Transcendence
****** Sunshine
***** Gattaca
****** Gravity
**** Interstellar
***** The Martian
***** Animatrix
**** Existenz
*** Splice
***** Ex Machina
**** Source Code
**** Minority Report
***** Annihilation
**** Sleepdealer
***** Hero (2002)




-17- Bildungsroman, Character-Driven Plots


**** Jaws
***** Topgun
****** Rocky
**** Creed
***** Raging Bull
******* The Wrestler
**** The Fighter




-18- Non-Traditional Westerns


**** Space Cowboys
******* No Country for Old Men
***** True Grit
****** The Hateful Eight
**** Dead Man
***** Gran Torino




-19- Inspiring Biopics Based on Historical Figures


**** Charlie Wilson’s War
***** Milk
***** Frost / Nixon
****** Citizenfour
***** Client 9 – The Rise and Fall of Eliot Spitzer
***** Schindler’s List
****** The Lives of Others
******* The Pianist
******* Gandhi
****** Lincoln
**** Bronson
***** Control
****** A Man for All Seasons
*** The Disaster Artist




-20- Intense Psychological Thrillers with Sci-Fi Elements


******* Children of Men
**** 28 Days Later
***** Contagion
******* The Hurt Locker
****** Blood Diamond




-21- Mystery with Interwoven Plot Twists


******* Inside Man
****** The Usual Suspects




-22- Films Built Around Excellent Characters


**** Few Good Men
**** Hacksaw Ridge
****** The Terminal
***** Sully
***** Saving Private Ryan
*** Dunkirk
***** The King’s Speech
****** Forrest Gump
****** Birdman
***** Patch Adams
***** Billy Elliot
****** 12 Years a Slave
**** Born on the Fourth of July
***** The Social Network
******* There Will Be Blood
***** Gladiator
**** The Great Debaters
***** Cast Away
**** Dante’s Peak
**** Arctic
**** Moneyball
***** The Green Mile
******* The Aviator
***** Michael Clayton
**** Slumdog Millionaire
***** Ford vs. Ferrari
***** Blow-Up
**** Lion
***** Moonlight
****** Ida
**** The Shawshank Redemption
***** Dolemite is My Name




-23- Classic Films

Classic films. These are paced slower (exception Hitchcock), avant-garde and not for everyone.

*** Eraserhead
***** Stranger than Paradise
*** Teorema
***** Mister Lonely
***** Last Year at Marienbad
******* Hiroshima Mon Amour
***** 2001: A Space Odyssey
**** The Cabinet of Dr Caligari
****** Psycho
**** Vertigo
**** Amor Estranho Amor
******* The Tenant




-24- Mainstream Classics

Mainstream classics. Good to have in your vocabulary if you’re a film buff, good for igniting nostalgia.

******* Strangers On A Train
****** Dr Strangelove
**** It’s a Wonderful Life
***** Stagecoach
**** Arsenic and Old Lace
***** Casablanca
**** A Streetcar Named Desire
*** Saturday Night Fever
******* Citizen Kane
**** In a Lonely Place
****** Lolita




-25- Psychological Thrillers on Dark Human Themes

Psychological thrillers dealing with darker aspects of the human condition (drug use, self-identity, abuse).

***** Boy A
**** Mysterious Skin
****** Trainspotting
****** My Beautiful Laundrette
*** The Girl Next Door
******* Requiem for a Dream
***** A Simple Plan
******* Boys Don’t Cry
******* Starred Up
***** Black Swan
****** Boyhood
***** Kids
*** Irréversible




-26- Dark Psychological Thrillers, Male-Centric

Well-made, classic, extremely entertaining psychological thrillers with dark subject matter, centered around male characters.

******* Fight Club
******* A Clockwork Orange
***** American History X
***** Bad Boys
***** Cool Hand Luke




-27- Action Films with Sci-Fi Roots

Great action films with science fiction roots, plenty of suspense and entertainment. Well-constructed, original mise-en-scene.

***** District 9
***** Arrival
****** Predator
**** Contact
******* Alien
**** Prometheus
**** Aliens
***** Jurassic Park
**** A Quiet Place




-28- Off-Beat, Original Human Dramas

Slightly off-beat, highly original human drama. Slow-paced, but rich in both production and entertainment value.

***** Magnolia
****** 500 Days of Summer
****** Silver Linings Playbook
**** I’m Here (Short)
**** K-pax
**** Kontroll
**** The Squid and the Whale
***** Little Miss Sunshine
****** Amelie
**** Doubt
**** Up in the Air
**** Palindromes
****** Y Tu Mama Tambien
***** Wristcutters: A Love Story
****** Taxi Driver
****** The Grand Budapest Hotel
***** Moonrise Kingdom
**** Beginners
***** Hunt for the Wilderpeople
*** I Heart Huckabees
***** Cleo from 5 to 7
******* One Flew Over The Cuckoo’s Nest
**** Happiness
***** Shame
**** Life During Wartime
**** American Beauty
***** Rain Man
****** Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
**** The Florida Project
*** The Big Sick
***** Call Me by Your Name
*** La La Land
******* In the Mood for Love
**** Chungking Express




-29- Quintessential Psychological Thrillers

Quintessential psychological thrillers. High entertainment value, with seminal performances by many great actors.

***** The Machinist
****** The Shining
****** Shutter Island
****** Primal Fear
***** Donnie Darko
**** The Butterfly Effect
****** Being John Malkovich
****** The Departed
***** The Prestige
***** V for Vendetta
***** Killing of a Sacred Deer




-30- Slow-Paced Suburban Dramas

Slow-paced drama about suburban life, usually with a good message. Interesting plots.

**** Stand By Me
***** Pleasantville
**** To Die For
**** Baby It’s You




-31- Excellent Script-Driven Dramas

Excellent scripts, drama, and high-entertainment value. I might merge this with category 22 in the near future.

**** The Illusionist
****** A Beautiful Mind
****** The Theory of Everything
****** The Imitation Game
***** The Sixth Sense
****** Pi
******* Good Will Hunting
***** The Curious Case of Benjamin Button




-32- American Films with Quick-Witted Protagonists

Very ‘American’ films. Watch these for their quick-witted protagonists, con artists, thieves and coming-of-age themes.

***** The Truman Show
*** Boiler Room
***** Reality Bites
****** Risky Business
**** Rounders
******* Catch Me If You Can
****** Bridge of Spies
**** House of Games
***** Matchstick Men
***** Blow Out




-33- Tim Burton Films

Tim Burton.

***** Nightmare Before Christmas
**** Ed Wood
**** Sweeney Todd




-34- American Gangster and Crime Dramas

American Gangster and crime dramas. Classically entertaining and technically excellent films.

**** Scarface
******* Goodfellas
****** Once Upon a Time in America
******* Godfather I-II
**** Donnie Brasco
****** The Irishman




-35- Beautiful Documentaries on Exotic Phenomena

Beautiful documentaries about exotic phenomena. Watch for intellectual interest.

***** Hubble 3D
****** Helvetica
**** Ant Attack BBC




-36- Avant-Garde Animated Films

Avant-garde animated films with themes of nihilism, psychopathology, and the nature of human existence.

****** Rejected Cartoons
****** Rejected
****** It’s Such a Beautiful Day
****** Everything Will Be OK
***** Salad Fingers
**** Upstream Color
***** The Tree of Life

Avant-garde animated films with themes of nihilism, psychopathology, and the nature of human existence.

****** Rejected Cartoons
****** Rejected
****** It’s Such a Beautiful Day
****** Everything Will Be OK
***** Salad Fingers
**** Upstream Color
***** The Tree of Life

title: Films
text:
Films with Ratings and Categories


-1- Off-beat Action Films with Substance, Style, and a Sense of Ironic Humor

****** Forrest Gump

***** Patch Adams
***** Billy Elliot

******* There Will Be Blood

**** The Great Debaters

***** Ford vs. Ferrari
***** Blow-Up
**** Lion
***** Moonlight
****** Ida
**** The Shawshank Redemption
***** Dolemite is My Name




-23- Classic Films

Classic films. These are paced slower (exception Hitchcock), avant-garde and not for everyone.

*** Eraserhead
***** Stranger than Paradise
*** Teorema
***** Mister Lonely
***** Last Year at Marienbad
******* Hiroshima Mon Amour
***** 2001: A Space Odyssey
**** The Cabinet of Dr Caligari
****** Psycho
**** Vertigo
**** Amor Estranho Amor
******* The Tenant




-24- Mainstream Classics

Mainstream classics. Good to have in your vocabulary if you’re a film buff, good for igniting nostalgia.

******* Strangers On A Train
****** Dr Strangelove
**** It’s a Wonderful Life
***** Stagecoach
**** Arsenic and Old Lace
***** Casablanca
**** A Streetcar Named Desire
*** Saturday Night Fever
******* Citizen Kane
**** In a Lonely Place
****** Lolita




-25- Psychological Thrillers on Dark Human Themes

Psychological thrillers dealing with darker aspects of the human condition (drug use, self-identity, abuse).

***** Boy A
**** Mysterious Skin
****** Trainspotting
****** My Beautiful Laundrette
*** The Girl Next Door
******* Requiem for a Dream
***** A Simple Plan
******* Boys Don’t Cry
******* Starred Up
***** Black Swan
****** Boyhood
***** Kids
*** Irréversible




-26- Dark Psychological Thrillers, Male-Centric

Well-made, classic, extremely entertaining psychological thrillers with dark subject matter, centered around male characters.

******* Fight Club
******* A Clockwork Orange
***** American History X
***** Bad Boys
***** Cool Hand Luke




-27- Action Films with Sci-Fi Roots

Great action films with science fiction roots, plenty of suspense and entertainment. Well-constructed, original mise-en-scene.

***** District 9
***** Arrival
****** Predator
**** Contact
******* Alien
**** Prometheus
**** Aliens
***** Jurassic Park
**** A Quiet Place




-28- Off-Beat, Original Human Dramas

Slightly off-beat, highly original human drama. Slow-paced, but rich in both production and entertainment value.

***** Magnolia
****** 500 Days of Summer
****** Silver Linings Playbook
**** I’m Here (Short)
**** K-pax
**** Kontroll
**** The Squid and the Whale
***** Little Miss Sunshine
****** Amelie
**** Doubt
**** Up in the Air
**** Palindromes
****** Y Tu Mama Tambien
***** Wristcutters: A Love Story
****** Taxi Driver
****** The Grand Budapest Hotel
***** Moonrise Kingdom
**** Beginners
***** Hunt for the Wilderpeople
*** I Heart Huckabees
***** Cleo from 5 to 7
******* One Flew Over The Cuckoo’s Nest
**** Happiness
***** Shame
**** Life During Wartime
**** American Beauty
***** Rain Man
****** Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
**** The Florida Project
*** The Big Sick
***** Call Me by Your Name
*** La La Land
******* In the Mood for Love
**** Chungking Express




-29- Quintessential Psychological Thrillers

Quintessential psychological thrillers. High entertainment value, with seminal performances by many great actors.

***** The Machinist
****** The Shining
****** Shutter Island
****** Primal Fear
***** Donnie Darko
**** The Butterfly Effect
****** Being John Malkovich
****** The Departed
***** The Prestige
***** V for Vendetta
***** Killing of a Sacred Deer




-30- Slow-Paced Suburban Dramas

Slow-paced drama about suburban life, usually with a good message. Interesting plots.

**** Stand By Me
***** Pleasantville
**** To Die For
**** Baby It’s You




-31- Excellent Script-Driven Dramas

Excellent scripts, drama, and high-entertainment value. I might merge this with category 22 in the near future.

**** The Illusionist
****** A Beautiful Mind
****** The Theory of Everything
****** The Imitation Game
***** The Sixth Sense
****** Pi
******* Good Will Hunting
***** The Curious Case of Benjamin Button




-32- American Films with Quick-Witted Protagonists

Very ‘American’ films. Watch these for their quick-witted protagonists, con artists, thieves and coming-of-age themes.

***** The Truman Show
*** Boiler Room
***** Reality Bites
****** Risky Business
**** Rounders
******* Catch Me If You Can
****** Bridge of Spies
**** House of Games
***** Matchstick Men
***** Blow Out




-33- Tim Burton Films

Tim Burton.

***** Nightmare Before Christmas
**** Ed Wood
**** Sweeney Todd




-34- American Gangster and Crime Dramas

American Gangster and crime dramas. Classically entertaining and technically excellent films.

**** Scarface
******* Goodfellas
****** Once Upon a Time in America
******* Godfather I-II
**** Donnie Brasco
****** The Irishman




-35- Beautiful Documentaries on Exotic Phenomena

Beautiful documentaries about exotic phenomena. Watch for intellectual interest.

***** Hubble 3D
****** Helvetica
**** Ant Attack BBC




-36- Avant-Garde Animated Films

Avant-garde animated films with themes of nihilism, psychopathology, and the nature of human existence.

****** Rejected Cartoons
****** Rejected
****** It’s Such a Beautiful Day
****** Everything Will Be OK
***** Salad Fingers
**** Upstream Color
***** The Tree of Life
